front.title: Data Structure for the Security Suitability of Cryptographic Algorithms (DSSC)

abstract.t: In many application areas it must be possible to prove the existence and integrity of digital signed data. This proof depends on the security suitability of the cryptographic algorithms used to generate or verify the digital signature. Because algorithms can become weak over the years, it is necessary to periodically evaluate their security suitability. When signing or verifying data, these evaluations must be considered. This document specifies a data structure that enables automated analysis of the security suitability of cryptographic algorithms.
